Making the same queen move to Qxg6 would have been better. The move Qf6 was Black's only chance for a counterplay. Rxh7+ would have given White the chance to win the game with a forced mate after Black's Rxg6. Moving the rook to Rxh7+ is a strong tactical play. The king move to Kxh7 allowed White to deliver a check with Qh2+, which Black had to respond to with Rh5. The queen move to Qf4 was good, but when Black responds with Rf5, White should have played Qh2+ instead of Qd1+. The move Qd1+ leads to a losing position for White, as Black can avoid the checkmate with Kb2 and Black wins the game. The correct play was Qd1+.
